message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

The paper deals with the analysis of regenerating codes, which are commonly used in distributed storage networks. This topic falls under the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the selection of helper nodes, which is related to network communication (cs.NI) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper involves analyzing the storage-bandwidth tradeoff, which is a fundamental aspect of data storage and retrieval, and thus falls under the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
